Taxonomically, Nakaseomyces glabratus was initially classified under the genus Candida, but later reclassified into the newly established genus Nakaseomyces based on phylogenetic analyses of its ribosomal DNA sequences.

The ecological role and potential biotechnological applications of Nakaseomyces glabratus are still under investigation, as research on this species remains limited compared to other well-studied yeast species.
